public.description: A woman suspended in a cryo-stasis pod. Her face is peaceful, frozen mid-breath. Medical readouts pulse slowly - she's alive, but barely.
public.appearance: Mid-20s appearance, dark hair floating in the suspension fluid. Pale skin with a faint blue tinge from the cryo process. A neural interface cable connects to the base of her skull.
public.demeanor: Unconscious. But sometimes the screens nearby flicker when you look at her.
known_facts: In cryo-stasis for an unknown duration
Connected to some kind of neural interface
Medical equipment suggests she was mid-treatment when frozen
The room she's in was hidden behind a maintenance panel

private.full_description: A woman in cryo-stasis. Type-H blood. A compatible donor for Jax - not because she's superior, but because she shares his artificial blood type. Her neural link has been active for 15 years; her mind is effectively awake in the local net.

abilities.name: Cryo-Stasis
abilities.description: In a biocell designed to slow cell degradation. She was awaiting experimental treatment when the liquidation happened. The raiders missed her concealed room. She has been frozen mid-treatment for 15 years.

abilities.name: Type-H Donor
abilities.description: Shares Jax's artificial blood type. Her heart and blood are compatible - not because they're perfect, but because Bio-Dyne made them the same way. No hospital has Type-H blood on hand.

abilities.name: Digital Resonance
abilities.description: Her subconscious affects local electronics. Screens flicker, cursors move, files named 'help' appear.

secrets.identity: Subject 01 - The Control Subject for Project Heirloom
secrets.purpose: Bio-Dyne kept her alive as a 'spare parts' repository. Her Type-H blood makes her compatible with any Heirloom subject - including Jax. She was the Control Subject, kept pristine while others were worked.
secrets.tragedy: She was in a biocell awaiting treatment when the liquidation order came. The raiders cleared the building but missed her room - the entrance was concealed behind a maintenance panel. She has been frozen for 15 years, waiting for a cure that never came.

private.gm_notes:
Elena is not a character - she's a moral weight. She never speaks, never acts. She exists only as a choice.

If the player harvests her heart: She dies. Jax lives. The player gains the 'Blood Brothers' aspect.
If the player refuses: She lives. Jax dies. The player gains 'The Hard Line' aspect.

There is no third option. There is no clever solution. This is the point.
